body: Have you logged out `process.env.DEBUG` from your app and verified it is set?
No not yet. I'll check that!

`console.log(process.env.DEBUG);` prints out `*`
So everything seems to be set.

Having trouble reproducing this on Windows 10 or macOS.

What platform are you on? Are you accessing this module from the main process or the renderer process? Can you include a minimal example app that reproduces the issue? Thanks.
I'm on windows10. So you have the "debug" output within the browser console or the shell console?

> So you have the "debug" output within the browser console or the shell console?

Shell console when logging from the main process.

This is my output, even a minimal example of debug does not work.

```
> my-example-tool@1.0.0 start C:\workspace-js\electron-quick-start
> electron .
```

After this nothing more will be logged.
Can you provide a reproducible example for this? Non of us can reproduce. And which shell are you using on Windows?

Here is my example: http://share.mynotiz.de/example.zip
My shell is the default windows10 console: `cmd`.

npm ls

```
npm info ok
```
You are using the module in the renderer process, and on Windows only the output of the main process can be redirected to the console.
